instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP: Ensure 'Rajdhani' and 'JetBrains Mono' are imported in index.css.
2. MAP: Use 'react-leaflet' with 'CartoDB Dark Matter' tiles for the professional dark mode look. Do NOT use default OpenStreetMap tiles.
3. LAYOUT: Implement a 'Command Center' layout. Map is the base layer. Controls float over it or sit in a semi-transparent sidebar.
4. INTERACTION: When a user selects a location, flyTo that location on the map and update the Insights Panel.
5. VISUALS: Use the 'traffic_status' colors for map markers and charts. Add the 'glow' effect to high-congestion markers.
6. CHARTS: Use 'recharts' with a dark theme. Hide grid lines or make them very subtle (#333). Tooltips must be dark.
7. DATA-TESTID: Add 'data-testid' to all interactive elements (e.g., 'location-select', 'day-select', 'map-marker-silkboard').
8. MOCK DATA: Since backend is simulated, create a robust 'mockTrafficData' object in a separate file to power the visualizations.
universal_guidelines: Avoid generic 'Bootstrap' looks. Use custom spacing and borders.
Dark mode is mandatory. Do not implement light mode.
Ensure all text has sufficient contrast against the dark background (APCA/WCAG AA).
No 'Lorem Ipsum'. Use realistic traffic data labels (e.g., 'PCU/hr', 'Avg Speed', 'Congestion Level').
